title: Basic Card, Long Text
contents:
This is a basic card containing long text in paragraphs. 

Rerum incidunt voluptatem quo aliquid commodi veniam vitae consequatur. Ut quae in facere. Et ab sunt incidunt ea in sed quo. Sequi voluptas ex ipsum aliquam vel error rerum. Explicabo assumenda et qui. Cumque laudantium omnis sit. 
Non soluta iure autem libero fuga molestiae. Ea fuga ut corporis. Unde ducimus ut pariatur. 
Maxime dolor esse adipisci consequatur enim eos. Soluta et eius officia et voluptatem et enim. Asperiores voluptas inventore officia quis eveniet. Est id illum qui ipsum. Dicta modi in temporibus saepe harum aut sed velit. Sit fuga reprehenderit iste et. 
Qui debitis aperiam quam. Expedita est voluptatibus aut ratione in consequatur laboriosam. Molestias est aspernatur sint voluptas saepe tempora repellat. Similique et vero ipsum rem quo cum. Illo illum quaerat blanditiis adipisci illum illo. 
Sunt consequatur dolorum deserunt. Necessitatibus et rerum sunt eos impedit harum nulla et. Est doloribus maxime aut non qui debitis quia. Veritatis veritatis natus placeat amet tenetur dolorum. Id sed omnis aut sed minima temporibus est dolorem. Sint in earum repellendus.

title: Markdown Card -- Headings
contents:
This card contains markdown formatted headings:

# This is a Title

## This is a second-level heading

### This is a third-level heading

#### This is a fourth-level heading

##### This is a fifth-level heading

title: Markdown Card -- Text Styling
contents:
This card illustrates text formatting using markdown:

You can indicate emphasis with bold, italic, strikethrough, subscript, or superscript text in cards:

Bold: Use ```**text**```  to create text **looking like this**. 

Italic: Use ```*text*``` to create text *looking like this*.

Underline: Use ```_text_``` to create _underlined text_.

Strikethrough: Use ```~text~``` to create text ~looking like this~.

Subscript: Use ```<sub>text</sub>``` to create text looking like this: <sub> text</sub>.

Superscript: Use ```<sup>text</sup>``` to create text looking like this <sup>text</sup>.

title: Markdown Card -- Quotes
contents:
Qutes are supported in markdown format. Use ```>``` to display a quote:

> The rain in Spain stays mainly in the plain.

title: Markdown Card -- Code
contents:
Inline and block formatting for code is available in Flashkarti:

For inline code formatting use single backticks `like this`. 

For block code formatting use triple backtics like the example below: 

```
def hello_world():
    print("Hello, World!")
```

title: Markdown Card -- Lists
contents:
You can make an unordered list by preceding one or more lines of text with `-`, `*`, or `+`.
You can make an ordered list by preceding the lines with `1.`.

An unordered list:
- item 1
- item 2

An ordered list:
1. step 1
2. step 2
